required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Diet and Sleep in Vascular Health
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Diet on Sleep and Cardiovascular Risk

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to test the impact of diet on sleep and cardiovascular disease risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock: Poor sleep quality is highly prevalent in adults in the U.S. and worldwide. Recent work suggests that dietary intakes may influence sleep. This mechanistic study will test whether consuming a healthy, Mediterranean diet will improve sleep quality in U.S. adults with poor sleep and lead to better cardiovascular disease risk profile. Given the relationship between sleep and cardiovascular health, improving sleep quality through dietary measures could contribute to improving health in adults.

study_design_info.masking_description: Statistician and research technicians involved in data and sample analyses will be blind to intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Score on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
primary_outcome.description: The 19 questions which compose this survey assess sleep quality, latency, duration, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, medication use and daytime dysfunction. Scores range 0 (minimum) to 21 (maximum) with >5 indicating poor sleep quality so a lower score is a better outcome.
Sleep fragmentation index will be actigraphy-derived.

secondary_outcome.description: Urinary 6-sulfatoxymelatonin will be measured by competitive ELISA and urine creatinine by clinical chemistry analyzer.

arm_group.description: Healthy participants that are randomized to the MedDiet followed by a 4-week washout and a crossover to the AAD.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Average American Diet (AAD) and then Mediterranean Diet
arm_group.description: Healthy participants that are randomized to AAD followed by a 4-week washout and a crossover to the Mediterranean Diet.

intervention.description: Participants will follow specified diet requirements. Macronutrient targets for the AAD will be approximately 35-37% of energy from fat (13.5% from saturated fat), 15% from protein, and 48-50% from carbohydrates (10 g fiber/d for an average 2000 kcal/d diet).
intervention.arm_group_label: Average American Diet (AAD) and then Mediterranean Diet

intervention.description: Participants will follow specified diet requirements. Macronutrient targets for the Mediterranean diet will be approximately 40% of energy from fat (8.5% from saturated fat), 20% of energy from protein, and 40% from carbohydrates (40 g fiber/d for an average 2000 kcal/d diet).
intervention.arm_group_label: Average American Diet (AAD) and then Mediterranean Diet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sleep >6 hours/night
- Sleep complaints
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoking
- Allergies to foods
- Inability to comply with study procedures
- Gastrointestinal disorders

patient_data.ipd_description: Will be shared upon request and review by investigators.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Upon publication of main study outcomes.
